item.title: Data from: Density triggers maternal hormones that increase adaptive offspring growth in a wild mammal
item.description: Source Background Effect of Density on fecal cortisol metabolites (Fig. 3/Table S4) Replication Red flags Forking paths Confounding Density and Treatment in Fig 3A,B/Table S4 What is effect of ignoring Chickadee manipulation in Fig 3C/Table S4 Summary of Red Flags for Figure 3/Table S4 Source Dantzer, B., Newman, A.E., Boonstra, R., Palme, R., Boutin, S., Humphries, M.M. and McAdam, A.G., 2013. Density triggers maternal hormones that increase adaptive offspring growth in a wild mammal.
